channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Even in the deep South, people dream of a snowy Christmas
item.description: People in the South keep hoping for a white Christmas, even though they know chances for snow are very very slim.
item.content:encoded: People in the South keep hoping for a white Christmas, even though they know chances for snow are very very slim.
item.dc:creator: Melanie Peeples

item.title: Warner Brothers has a long history of messy corporate marriages and divorces
item.description: As Netflix and Paramount continue their battle over Warner Brothers Discovery, we take a look back at the company's history of messy corporate marriages and divorces.
item.content:encoded: As Netflix and Paramount continue their battle over Warner Brothers Discovery, we take a look back at the company's history of messy corporate marriages and divorces.
item.dc:creator: Gregory Rosalsky

item.title: Trump announced a peace deal between Congo and Rwanda, but fighting hasn't stopped
item.description: Trump's peace deal between Rwanda and Congo hasn't stopped the fighting — and now his expansive mineral deal with Kinshasa is in the balance.
item.content:encoded: Trump's peace deal between Rwanda and Congo hasn't stopped the fighting — and now his expansive mineral deal with Kinshasa is in the balance.
item.dc:creator: Emmet Livingstone

item.title: It's been a great year for music. Here are some of NPR's favorite songs of 2025
item.description: From a song by a certified superstar that came out in the very first week of January to breakthroughs from lesser-known indie acts, here are selections from NPR Music's list of the best songs of 2025.
item.content:encoded: From a song by a certified superstar that came out in the very first week of January to breakthroughs from lesser-known indie acts, here are selections from NPR Music's list of the best songs of 2025.
item.dc:creator: Ann Powers

item.title: 'The Nutcracker' isn't just a cozy classic. It helps ballet companies pay the bills
item.description: About half of the revenue for American ballet companies each year comes from the cozy seasonal favorite "The Nutcracker." Since COVID, they have become even more dependent on those sugarplum fairies.
item.content:encoded: About half of the revenue for American ballet companies each year comes from the cozy seasonal favorite "The Nutcracker." Since COVID, they have become even more dependent on those sugarplum fairies.
item.dc:creator: Anastasia Tsioulcas

item.title: What cuts to research under Trump have meant for science in 2025
item.description: Trump administration officials say changes to federal agencies engaged in science were made in the interests of better science that benefits more Americans. Many scientists we spoke with disagree.
item.content:encoded: Trump administration officials say changes to federal agencies engaged in science were made in the interests of better science that benefits more Americans. Many scientists we spoke with disagree.
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: Bari Weiss halts '60 Minutes' story, sparking an outrage
item.description: CBS' new editor-in-chief spiked a 60 Minutes story shortly before it was to air, leading to concerns about whether the network and its owners are bowing to the Trump administration.
item.content:encoded: CBS' new editor-in-chief spiked a 60 Minutes story shortly before it was to air, leading to concerns about whether the network and its owners are bowing to the Trump administration.
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: 22 attorneys general have sued the Trump administration over CFPB funding
item.description: Twenty-two attorneys general have sued the Trump administration over funding for the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau. The consumer watchdog agency is close to running out of money.
item.content:encoded: Twenty-two attorneys general have sued the Trump administration over funding for the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau. The consumer watchdog agency is close to running out of money.
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: Trump's second term marks a significant departure from his first term, analysts say
item.description: President Trump's first year of foreign policy in his second term surprised many — for a lot of different reasons.
item.content:encoded: President Trump's first year of foreign policy in his second term surprised many — for a lot of different reasons.
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: Army command structure changes driven by Trump-era priorities and bid for efficiency
item.description: The Army is creating a command that will oversee planning and operations for the Americas and the Caribbean, with an emphasis on the nation's borders.
item.content:encoded: The Army is creating a command that will oversee planning and operations for the Americas and the Caribbean, with an emphasis on the nation's borders.
item.dc:creator: Jay Price
